intro: Botryopleuron plukenetii, commonly known as the African wax tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, followed by orange-red fruits containing seeds. Botryopleuron plukenetii thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its unique morphology and medicinal properties make it an important species in its native habitat.
